bit_ranges.name: VERSION
bit_ranges.description: Holds the controller version number.

bit_ranges.name: DRAM_CLASS
bit_ranges.description: Defines the class of DRAM memory which is connected to the controller.

bit_ranges.name: START
bit_ranges.description: Initiate command processing in the controller. Set to 1 to initiate.

bit_ranges.name: READ_DATA_FIFO_DEPTH
bit_ranges.description: Reports the depth of the controller core read data queue.

bit_ranges.name: MAX_CS_REG
bit_ranges.description: Holds the maximum number of chip selects available.

bit_ranges.name: MAX_COL_REG
bit_ranges.description: Holds the maximum width of column address in DRAMs.

bit_ranges.name: MAX_ROW_REG
bit_ranges.description: Holds the maximum width of memory address bus.

bit_ranges.name: MEMCD_RMODW_FIFO_DEPTH
bit_ranges.description: Reports the depth of the controller core read/modify/write FIFO.

bit_ranges.name: WRITE_DATA_FIFO_PTR_WIDTH
bit_ranges.description: Reports the width of the controller core write data latency queue pointer.

bit_ranges.name: WRITE_DATA_FIFO_DEPTH
bit_ranges.description: Reports the depth of the controller core write data latency queue.

bit_ranges.name: READ_DATA_FIFO_PTR_WIDTH
bit_ranges.description: Reports the width of the controller core read data queue pointer.

bit_ranges.name: DENALI0_WRFIFO_LOG2_DEPTH
bit_ranges.description: Reports the depth of the DENALI port 0 write data FIFO. Value is the log2 value of the depth.

bit_ranges.name: DENALI0_RMODWFIFO_LOG2_DEPTH
bit_ranges.description: Reports the depth of the DENALI port 0 read/modify/write FIFO. Value is the log2 value of the depth.

bit_ranges.name: DENALI0_CMDFIFO_LOG2_DEPTH
bit_ranges.description: Reports the depth of the DENALI port 0 command FIFO. Value is the log2 value of the depth.

bit_ranges.name: MEMCD_RMODW_FIFO_PTR_WIDTH
bit_ranges.description: Reports the width of the controller core read/modify/write FIFO pointer.

bit_ranges.name: DFS_CLOSE_BANKS
bit_ranges.description: Close all pages before doing DFS. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: DENALI0_WRCMD_SIDE_FIFO_LOG2_DEPTH
bit_ranges.description: Reports the depth of the DENALI port 0 processing FIFO. Value is the log2 value of the depth.

bit_ranges.name: TINIT_F0
bit_ranges.description: DRAM TINIT value for frequency copy 0 in cycles.

bit_ranges.name: TINIT3_F0
bit_ranges.description: DRAM TINIT3 value for frequency copy 0 in cycles.

bit_ranges.description: DRAM TINIT4 value for frequency copy 0 in cycles.

bit_ranges.name: TINIT5_F0
bit_ranges.description: DRAM TINIT5 value for frequency copy 0 in cycles.

bit_ranges.name: TINIT_F1
bit_ranges.description: DRAM TINIT value for frequency copy 1 in cycles.

bit_ranges.description: DRAM TINIT3 value for frequency copy 1 in cycles.

bit_ranges.name: TINIT4_F1
bit_ranges.description: DRAM TINIT4 value for frequency copy 1 in cycles.

bit_ranges.name: TINIT5_F1
bit_ranges.description: DRAM TINIT5 value for frequency copy 1 in cycles.

bit_ranges.name: TINIT_F2
bit_ranges.description: DRAM TINIT value for frequency copy 2 in cycles.

bit_ranges.description: DRAM TINIT3 value for frequency copy 2 in cycles.

bit_ranges.name: TINIT4_F2
bit_ranges.description: DRAM TINIT4 value for frequency copy 2 in cycles.

bit_ranges.name: NO_AUTO_MRR_INIT
bit_ranges.description: Disable MRR commands during initialization. Set to 1 to disable.

bit_ranges.name: TINIT5_F2
bit_ranges.description: DRAM TINIT5 value for frequency copy 2 in cycles.

bit_ranges.name: NO_MRW_INIT
bit_ranges.description: Disable MRW commands after training during initialization. Set to 1 to disable.

bit_ranges.name: NO_MRW_BT_INIT
bit_ranges.description: Disable MRW commands before training during initialization. Set to 1 to disable.

bit_ranges.name: DFI_INV_DATA_CS
bit_ranges.description: Forces the inversion of the dfi_rddata_cs_n_X and dfi_wrdata_cs_n_X signals. Set to 1 to force inversion.

bit_ranges.name: MRR_ERROR_STATUS
bit_ranges.description: Identifies the source of any MRR errors. Value of 1 indicates a violation.

bit_ranges.name: DFIBUS_BOOT_FREQ
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI bus boot frequency.

bit_ranges.name: DFIBUS_FREQ_INIT
bit_ranges.description: Defines the initial DFI bus frequency.

bit_ranges.name: PHY_INDEP_TRAIN_MODE
bit_ranges.description: Enable PHY independent training mode commands during initialization. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: NO_PHY_IND_TRAIN_INIT
bit_ranges.description: Disable PHY Independent Training during initialization. Set to 1 to disable.

bit_ranges.name: DFIBUS_FREQ_F2
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI bus frequency for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: DFIBUS_FREQ_F1
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI bus frequency for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: DFIBUS_FREQ_F0
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI bus frequency for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: TRST_PWRON
bit_ranges.description: Duration of memory reset during power-on initialization.

bit_ranges.name: CKE_INACTIVE
bit_ranges.description: Number of cycles after reset before CKE will be active.

bit_ranges.name: TDLL_F0

bit_ranges.name: CASLAT_LIN_F0
bit_ranges.description: Sets latency from read command send to data receive from/to controller for frequency copy 0. Bit (0) is half-cycle increment and the upper bits define memory CAS latency for the controller.

bit_ranges.name: CASLAT_LIN_F1
bit_ranges.description: Sets latency from read command send to data receive from/to controller for frequency copy 1. Bit (0) is half-cycle increment and the upper bits define memory CAS latency for the controller.

bit_ranges.description: DRAM additive latency value for frequency copy 0 in cycles.

bit_ranges.name: TBST_INT_INTERVAL

bit_ranges.name: TRAS_LOCKOUT
bit_ranges.description: IF the DRAM supports it, this allows the controller to execute auto pre- charge commands before the TRAS_MIN parameter expires. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: CONCURRENTAP
bit_ranges.description: IF the DRAM supports it, this allows the controller to issue commands to other banks while a bank is in auto pre-charge. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.description: Enable auto pre-charge mode of controller. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: BSTLEN

bit_ranges.name: SREFRESH_EXIT_NO_REFRESH
bit_ranges.description: Disables the automatic refresh request associated with self-refresh exit. Set to 1 to disable.

bit_ranges.name: PWRUP_SREFRESH_EXIT
bit_ranges.description: Allow powerup via self-refresh instead of full memory initialization. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.description: DRAM TCMDCKE value for frequency copy 2 in cycles.

bit_ranges.description: DRAM TCSCKEH value for frequency copy 2 in cycles.

bit_ranges.name: DFS_STATUS
bit_ranges.description: Holds the error associated with the DFS interrupt. Bit (0) set indicates an illegal command and bit (1) set indicates that a shutdown occurred during DFS.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use. Refer to the regconfig files for the default programming.

bit_ranges.name: CKE_DELAY
bit_ranges.description: Additional cycles to delay CKE for status reporting.

bit_ranges.name: ENABLE_QUICK_SREFRESH
bit_ranges.description: Allow user to interrupt memory initialization to enter self-refresh mode. Set to 1 to allow interruption.

bit_ranges.name: DFS_RDLVL_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enables read data eye training during a DFS exit. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: DFS_WRLVL_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enables write leveling during a DFS exit. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: DFS_CALVL_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enables CA training during a DFS exit. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: DFS_ZQ_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enables ZQ calibration during a DFS exit. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: DFS_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F0
bit_ranges.description: DFS promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 0. Applies to SW and HW DFS commands.

bit_ranges.name: DFS_RDLVL_GATE_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enables read gate training during a DFS exit. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: DFS_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F2
bit_ranges.description: DFS promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 2. Applies to SW and HW DFS commands.

bit_ranges.name: DFS_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F1
bit_ranges.description: DFS promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 1. Applies to SW and HW DFS commands.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use. Refer to the regconfig files for the default programming.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CALINIT_CS_CL_STATUS
bit_ranges.description: Holds the status associated with the ZQ calibration interrupt. Bit (0) indicates that the ZQCS timer was exceeded and bit (1) indicates a ZQ command was received when memory was in the self-refresh state and the command was terminated without execution.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CALLATCH_STATUS
bit_ranges.description: Holds the status associated with the ZQ calibration interrupt. Bit (0) indicates that the ZQ cal latch timer was exceeded and bit (1) indicates a ZQ command was received when memory was in the self-refresh state and the command was terminated without execution.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CALSTART_STATUS
bit_ranges.description: Holds the status associated with the ZQ calibration interrupt. Bit (0) indicates that the ZQ cal start timer was exceeded and bit (1) indicates a ZQ command was received when memory was in the self-refresh state and the command was terminated without execution.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use. Refer to the regconfig files for the default programming.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use. Refer to the regconfig files for the default programming.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use. Refer to the regconfig files for the default programming.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use. Refer to the regconfig files for the default programming.

bit_ranges.name: UPD_CTRLUPD_HIGH_THRESHOLD_F0
bit_ranges.description: DFI control update number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: UPD_CTRLUPD_NORM_THRESHOLD_F0
bit_ranges.description: DFI control update number of long counts until the normal priority request is asserted for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: UPD_CTRLUPD_SW_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F0
bit_ranges.description: DFI control update SW promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: UPD_CTRLUPD_TIMEOUT_F0
bit_ranges.description: DFI control update number of long counts until the timeout is asserted for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: UPD_CTRLUPD_NORM_THRESHOLD_F1
bit_ranges.description: DFI control update number of long counts until the normal priority request is asserted for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: UPD_PHYUPD_DFI_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F0
bit_ranges.description: DFI PHY update DFI promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: UPD_CTRLUPD_TIMEOUT_F1
bit_ranges.description: DFI control update number of long counts until the timeout is asserted for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: UPD_CTRLUPD_HIGH_THRESHOLD_F1
bit_ranges.description: DFI control update number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: UPD_PHYUPD_DFI_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F1
bit_ranges.description: DFI PHY update DFI promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: UPD_CTRLUPD_SW_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F1
bit_ranges.description: DFI control update SW promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: UPD_CTRLUPD_HIGH_THRESHOLD_F2
bit_ranges.description: DFI control update number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: UPD_CTRLUPD_NORM_THRESHOLD_F2
bit_ranges.description: DFI control update number of long counts until the normal priority request is asserted for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: UPD_CTRLUPD_SW_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F2
bit_ranges.description: DFI control update SW promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: UPD_CTRLUPD_TIMEOUT_F2
bit_ranges.description: DFI control update number of long counts until the timeout is asserted for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_PHYMSTR_MAX_F0
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHYMSTR_MAX timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles that dfi_phymstr_req following the assertion of dfi_phymstr_ack can be asserted, for frequency copy 0. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (0) set in the PHYMSTR_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: UPD_PHYUPD_DFI_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F2
bit_ranges.description: DFI PHY update DFI promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: PHYMSTR_DFI_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F0
bit_ranges.description: DFI PHY master request promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_PHYMSTR_RESP_F0
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHYMSTR_RESP timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles between a dfi_phymstr_req assertion and a dfi_phymstr_ack assertion, for frequency copy 0. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (1) set in the PHYMSTR_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_PHYMSTR_RESP_F1
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHYMSTR_RESP timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles between a dfi_phymstr_req assertion and a dfi_phymstr_ack assertion, for frequency copy 1. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (1) set in the PHYMSTR_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_PHYMSTR_MAX_F1
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHYMSTR_MAX timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles that dfi_phymstr_req following the assertion of dfi_phymstr_ack can be asserted, for frequency copy 1. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (0) set in the PHYMSTR_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_PHYMSTR_MAX_F2
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHYMSTR_MAX timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles that dfi_phymstr_req following the assertion of dfi_phymstr_ack can be asserted, for frequency copy 2. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (0) set in the PHYMSTR_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: PHYMSTR_DFI_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F1
bit_ranges.description: DFI PHY master request promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: PHYMSTR_DFI_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F2
bit_ranges.description: DFI PHY master request promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_PHYMSTR_RESP_F2
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHYMSTR_RESP timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles between a dfi_phymstr_req assertion and a dfi_phymstr_ack assertion, for frequency copy 2. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (1) set in the PHYMSTR_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: MRR_TEMPCHK_NORM_THRESHOLD_F0
bit_ranges.description: MRR temp check number of long counts until the normal priority request is asserted for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: PHYMSTR_ERROR_STATUS
bit_ranges.description: Identifies the source of any DFI PHY Master Interface errors. Value of 1 indicates a timing violation of the associated timing parameter.

bit_ranges.name: PHYMSTR_NO_AREF
bit_ranges.description: Disables refreshes during the PHY master interface sequence. Set to 1 to disable. Refreshes during reset are only supported for DFI 4.0 and this parameter may be set or cleared for DFI 4.0. For all other DFI versions, this parameter must be set to 1.

bit_ranges.name: MRR_TEMPCHK_TIMEOUT_F0
bit_ranges.description: MRR temp check number of long counts until the timeout is asserted for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: MRR_TEMPCHK_HIGH_THRESHOLD_F0
bit_ranges.description: MRR temp check number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: MRR_TEMPCHK_HIGH_THRESHOLD_F1
bit_ranges.description: MRR temp check number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: MRR_TEMPCHK_NORM_THRESHOLD_F1
bit_ranges.description: MRR temp check number of long counts until the normal priority request is asserted for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: MRR_TEMPCHK_NORM_THRESHOLD_F2
bit_ranges.description: MRR temp check number of long counts until the normal priority request is asserted for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: MRR_TEMPCHK_TIMEOUT_F1
bit_ranges.description: MRR temp check number of long counts until the timeout is asserted for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: MRR_TEMPCHK_TIMEOUT_F2
bit_ranges.description: MRR temp check number of long counts until the timeout is asserted for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: MRR_TEMPCHK_HIGH_THRESHOLD_F2
bit_ranges.description: MRR temp check number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: CKSRE_F1
bit_ranges.description: Clock hold delay on self-refresh entry for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: CKSRX_F0
bit_ranges.description: Clock stable delay on self-refresh exit for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: CKSRE_F0
bit_ranges.description: Clock hold delay on self-refresh entry for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: LOWPOWER_REFRESH_ENABLE
bit_ranges.description: Enable refreshes while in low power mode. Bit (0) controls cs0, bit (1) controls cs1, etc. Set each bit to 1 to disable.

bit_ranges.name: LP_CMD
bit_ranges.description: Low power software command request interface. Bit (0) controls exit, bit (1) controls entry, bits (4:2) define the low power state, bit (5) controls memory clock gating, bit (6) controls controller clock gating, and bit (7) controls lock.

bit_ranges.name: CKSRX_F2
bit_ranges.description: Clock stable delay on self-refresh exit for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: CKSRE_F2
bit_ranges.description: Clock hold delay on self-refresh entry for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: CKSRX_F1
bit_ranges.description: Clock stable delay on self-refresh exit for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: LPI_SRPD_LITE_WAKEUP_F0
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tLP_WAKEUP timing parameter (in DFI clocks) to be driven when memory is in self- refresh power down lite, for frequncy copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: LPI_SR_MCCLK_GATE_WAKEUP_F0
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tLP_WAKEUP timing parameter (in DFI clocks) to be driven when memory is in self- refresh with memory and controller clock gating, for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: LPI_SR_WAKEUP_F0
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tLP_WAKEUP timing parameter (in DFI clocks) to be driven when memory is in self- refresh for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: LPI_PD_WAKEUP_F0
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tLP_WAKEUP timing parameter (in DFI clocks) to be driven when memory is in power-down for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: LPI_PD_WAKEUP_F1
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tLP_WAKEUP timing parameter (in DFI clocks) to be driven when memory is in power-down for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: LPI_TIMER_WAKEUP_F0
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tLP_WAKEUP timing parameter (in DFI clocks) to be driven when the LPI timer expires for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: LPI_SRPD_DEEP_MCCLK_GATE_WAKEUP_F0
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tLP_WAKEUP timing parameter (in DFI clocks) to be driven when memory is in self- refresh power down deep with memory and controller clock gating, for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: LPI_SRPD_DEEP_WAKEUP_F0
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tLP_WAKEUP timing parameter (in DFI clocks) to be driven when memory is in self- refresh power down deep, for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: LPI_SRPD_DEEP_WAKEUP_F1
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tLP_WAKEUP timing parameter (in DFI clocks) to be driven when memory is in self- refresh power down deep, for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: LPI_SRPD_LITE_WAKEUP_F1
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tLP_WAKEUP timing parameter (in DFI clocks) to be driven when memory is in self- refresh power down lite, for frequncy copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: LPI_SR_MCCLK_GATE_WAKEUP_F1
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tLP_WAKEUP timing parameter (in DFI clocks) to be driven when memory is in self- refresh with memory and controller clock gating, for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: LPI_SR_WAKEUP_F1
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tLP_WAKEUP timing parameter (in DFI clocks) to be driven when memory is in self- refresh for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: LPI_SR_WAKEUP_F2
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tLP_WAKEUP timing parameter (in DFI clocks) to be driven when memory is in self- refresh for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: LPI_PD_WAKEUP_F2
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tLP_WAKEUP timing parameter (in DFI clocks) to be driven when memory is in power-down for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: LPI_TIMER_WAKEUP_F1
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tLP_WAKEUP timing parameter (in DFI clocks) to be driven when the LPI timer expires for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: LPI_SRPD_DEEP_MCCLK_GATE_WAKEUP_F1
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tLP_WAKEUP timing parameter (in DFI clocks) to be driven when memory is in self- refresh power down deep with memory and controller clock gating, for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: LPI_SRPD_DEEP_MCCLK_GATE_WAKEUP_F2
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tLP_WAKEUP timing parameter (in DFI clocks) to be driven when memory is in self- refresh power down deep with memory and controller clock gating, for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: LPI_SRPD_DEEP_WAKEUP_F2
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tLP_WAKEUP timing parameter (in DFI clocks) to be driven when memory is in self- refresh power down deep, for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: LPI_SRPD_LITE_WAKEUP_F2
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tLP_WAKEUP timing parameter (in DFI clocks) to be driven when memory is in self- refresh power down lite, for frequncy copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: LPI_SR_MCCLK_GATE_WAKEUP_F2
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tLP_WAKEUP timing parameter (in DFI clocks) to be driven when memory is in self- refresh with memory and controller clock gating, for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: LPI_TIMER_COUNT
bit_ranges.description: Defines the LPI timer count.

bit_ranges.name: LPI_WAKEUP_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enables the various low power wakeup parameters. Bit (0) enables power-down wakeup, bit (1) enables self-refresh wakeup, bit (2) enables self-refresh with memory and controller clock gating wakeup, bit (3) is reserved and bit (4) enables the LPI timer. Set each bit to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: LPI_TIMER_WAKEUP_F2
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tLP_WAKEUP timing parameter (in DFI clocks) to be driven when the LPI timer expires for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: LP_STATE
bit_ranges.description: Low power state status parameter. Bits (4:0) indicate the current low power state and bit (5) set indicates that status bits are valid.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_LP_RESP
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tLP_RESP timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles between a dfi_lp_req assertion and a dfi_lp_ack assertion.

bit_ranges.name: LPI_WAKEUP_TIMEOUT
bit_ranges.description: Defines the LPI timeout time, the maximum cycles between a dfi_lp_req de-assertion and a dfi_lp_ack de-assertion. If this value is exceeded, an interrupt will occur.

bit_ranges.name: LP_AUTO_MEM_GATE_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enable memory clock gating when entering a low power state via the auto low power counters. Bit (0) controls power-down, and bit (1) controls self-refresh. Set each bit to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: LP_AUTO_EXIT_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enable auto exit from each of the low power states when a read or write command enters the command queue. Bit (0) controls power-down, bit (1) controls lite self-refresh, and bit (2) controls deep self-refresh. Set each bit to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: LP_AUTO_ENTRY_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enable auto entry into each of the low power states when the associated idle timer expires. Bit (0) controls power-down, bit (1) controls self-refresh, bit (2) controls self-refresh with memory and controller clock gating, and bit (3) is reserved. Set each bit to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: LP_AUTO_SRPD_LITE_IDLE
bit_ranges.description: Defines the idle time until the controller will place memory in self- refresh power-down lite mode.

bit_ranges.name: LP_AUTO_PD_IDLE
bit_ranges.description: Defines the idle time until the controller will place memory in active power-down.

bit_ranges.name: HW_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F0
bit_ranges.description: HW interface promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: LP_AUTO_SR_MC_GATE_IDLE
bit_ranges.description: Number of long count sequences until the controller will place memory in self-refresh with controller and memory clock gating.

bit_ranges.name: LP_AUTO_SR_IDLE
bit_ranges.description: Number of long count sequences until the controller will place memory in self-refresh.

bit_ranges.name: HW_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F2
bit_ranges.description: HW interface promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: HW_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F1
bit_ranges.description: HW interface promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: LPC_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F1
bit_ranges.description: LPC promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 1. Applies to SW and auto low power commands.

bit_ranges.name: LPC_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F0
bit_ranges.description: LPC promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 0. Applies to SW and auto low power commands.

bit_ranges.name: LPC_SR_PHYUPD_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enable LPC to execute a DFI PHY update on a self-refresh exit sequence. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: LPC_SR_CTRLUPD_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enable LPC to execute a DFI control update on a self-refresh exit sequence. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: LPC_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F2
bit_ranges.description: LPC promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 2. Applies to SW and auto low power commands.

bit_ranges.name: LPC_SR_ZQ_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enable LPC to execute a ZQ calibration on a self-refresh exit sequence. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use. Refer to the regconfig files for the default programming.

bit_ranges.name: LPC_SR_PHYMSTR_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enable LPC to execute a DFI PHY Master request on a self-refresh exit sequence. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: DFS_DLL_OFF
bit_ranges.description: Defines if the memory DLL must be off for the associated frequency set. Bit (0) corresponds to frequency set 0, bit (1) corresponds to frequency set 1, etc. Set each bit to 1 to require DLL off.

bit_ranges.name: DFS_ENABLE
bit_ranges.description: Enable hardware dynamic frequency scaling. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use. Refer to the regconfig files for the default programming.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_INIT_START_F1
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tINIT_START timing parameter (in DFI clocks) for frequency copy 1, the maximum number of cycles between a dfi_init_start assertion and a dfi_init_complete de-assertion from the PHY.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_INIT_COMPLETE_F0
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tINIT_COMPLETE timing parameter (in DFI clocks) for frequency copy 0, the maximum cycles between a dfi_init_start de- assertion and a dfi_init_complete assertion from the PHY.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_INIT_START_F0
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tINIT_START timing parameter (in DFI clocks) for frequency copy 0, the maximum number of cycles between a dfi_init_start assertion and a dfi_init_complete de-assertion from the PHY.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_INIT_START_F2
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tINIT_START timing parameter (in DFI clocks) for frequency copy 2, the maximum number of cycles between a dfi_init_start assertion and a dfi_init_complete de-assertion from the PHY.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_INIT_COMPLETE_F1
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tINIT_COMPLETE timing parameter (in DFI clocks) for frequency copy 1, the maximum cycles between a dfi_init_start de- assertion and a dfi_init_complete assertion from the PHY.

bit_ranges.name: DFS_PHY_REG_WRITE_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enable a register write to the PHY during a frequency change. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: CURRENT_REG_COPY
bit_ranges.description: Indicates the current copy of timing parameters that is in use by the controller.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_INIT_COMPLETE_F2
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tINIT_COMPLETE timing parameter (in DFI clocks) for frequency copy 2, the maximum cycles between a dfi_init_start de- assertion and a dfi_init_complete assertion from the PHY.

bit_ranges.name: DFS_PHY_REG_WRITE_ADDR
bit_ranges.description: Register address which will be written during a frequency change. Must be a PHY register address.

bit_ranges.name: DFS_PHY_REG_WRITE_DATA_F0
bit_ranges.description: Register data which will be written during a frequency change for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: DFS_PHY_REG_WRITE_DATA_F1
bit_ranges.description: Register data which will be written during a frequency change for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: DFS_PHY_REG_WRITE_DATA_F2
bit_ranges.description: Register data which will be written during a frequency change for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: DFS_PHY_REG_WRITE_MASK
bit_ranges.description: Register mask which will be written during a frequency change.

bit_ranges.name: WRITE_MODEREG
bit_ranges.description: Write memory mode register data to the DRAMs. Bits (7:0) define the memory mode register number if bit (23) is set, bits (15:8) define the chip select if bit (24) is clear, bits (23:16) define which memory mode register/s to write, bit (24) defines whether all chip selects will be written, and bit (25) triggers the write.

bit_ranges.name: READ_MODEREG
bit_ranges.description: Read the specified memory mode register from specified chip when start bit set. Bits (7:0) define the memory mode register and bits (15:8) define the chip select. Set bit (16) to 1 to trigger.

bit_ranges.name: MRW_STATUS
bit_ranges.description: Write memory mode register status. Bit (0) set indicates a WRITE_MODEREG parameter programming error. Bit (1) set indicates a PASR error. Bit (2) is Reserved. Bit (3) set indicates a self refresh or deep power down error. Bit (4) set indicates that a write to MR3 or MR11 was attempted (WRITE_MODEREG bit (25) was asserted with bit (17) set, or bit (23) was asserted with bits (7:0) defining MR3 or MR11) during tZQCAL after a ZQ calibration start command.

bit_ranges.name: PERIPHERAL_MRR_DATA [31:0]
bit_ranges.description: Data and chip returned from memory mode register read requested by the READ_MODEREG parameter. Bits (7:0) indicate the read data and bits (15:8) indicate the chip.

bit_ranges.name: AUTO_TEMPCHK_VAL_0
bit_ranges.description: MR4 data for all devices on chip 0 accessed by automatic MRR commands. Bits (3:0) correlate to the device on the lower byte, bits (7:4) correlate to the devices on the 2nd byte etc. Value indicates the OP7, OP2, OP1 and OP0 bits.

bit_ranges.name: PERIPHERAL_MRR_DATA [39:32]
bit_ranges.description: Data and chip returned from memory mode register read requested by the READ_MODEREG parameter. Bits (7:0) indicate the read data and bits (15:8) indicate the chip.

bit_ranges.name: DISABLE_UPDATE_TVRCG
bit_ranges.description: Bypass changing for TVRCG during a DFS operation. Set to 1 to skip TVRCG.

bit_ranges.name: AUTO_TEMPCHK_VAL_1
bit_ranges.description: MR4 data for all devices on chip 1 accessed by automatic MRR commands. Bits (3:0) correlate to the device on the lower byte, bits (7:4) correlate to the devices on the 2nd byte etc. Value indicates the OP7, OP2, OP1 and OP0 bits.

bit_ranges.name: TVRCG_ENABLE_F0
bit_ranges.description: JEDEC TVRCG_ENABLE time.

bit_ranges.name: MRW_DFS_UPDATE_FRC
bit_ranges.description: Defines the frequency register set to use when doing a software MRW with WRITE_MODEREG bit (26).

bit_ranges.name: TFC_F0
bit_ranges.description: JEDEC TFC, the frequency set point switching time.

bit_ranges.name: TVRCG_DISABLE_F0
bit_ranges.description: JEDEC TVRCG_DISABLE time.

bit_ranges.name: TVREF_LONG_F0
bit_ranges.description: JEDEC TVREF, design will always use the long value.

bit_ranges.name: TCKFSPX_F0
bit_ranges.description: JEDEC TCKFSPX, the valid clock requirement before 1st valid command after FSP change.

bit_ranges.name: TCKFSPE_F0
bit_ranges.description: JEDEC TCKFSPE, the valid clock requirement after entering SDP change.

bit_ranges.name: TVRCG_DISABLE_F1
bit_ranges.description: JEDEC TVRCG_DISABLE time.

bit_ranges.name: TVRCG_ENABLE_F1
bit_ranges.description: JEDEC TVRCG_ENABLE time.

bit_ranges.name: TCKFSPX_F1
bit_ranges.description: JEDEC TCKFSPX, the valid clock requirement before 1st valid command after FSP change.

bit_ranges.name: TCKFSPE_F1
bit_ranges.description: JEDEC TCKFSPE, the valid clock requirement after entering SDP change.

bit_ranges.name: TFC_F1
bit_ranges.description: JEDEC TFC, the frequency set point switching time.

bit_ranges.name: TVRCG_ENABLE_F2
bit_ranges.description: JEDEC TVRCG_ENABLE time.

bit_ranges.name: TVREF_LONG_F1

bit_ranges.name: FSP_PHY_UPDATE_MRW
bit_ranges.description: Identifies the logic responsible for updating MR12 and MR14 in memory. Clear to 0 for the controller, or set to 1 for the PHY or PI.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use. Refer to the regconfig files for the default programming.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use. Refer to the regconfig files for the default programming.

bit_ranges.name: RL3_SUPPORT_EN
bit_ranges.description: Indicates if RL3 is supported by a connected LPDDR3 memory. Data read from MR0 bit 7.

bit_ranges.name: FSP_WR_CURRENT
bit_ranges.description: Reports which FSP set the memory will target with write commands.

bit_ranges.name: FSP_OP_CURRENT
bit_ranges.description: Reports which FSP set the memory is currently using.

bit_ranges.name: FSP_STATUS
bit_ranges.description: Indicates that a DFS event caused the FSP mode registers to be updated. Value of 1 means that the FSP mode registers were changed.

bit_ranges.name: DFS_ALWAYS_WRITE_FSP
bit_ranges.description: Forces all FSP mode registers to be written by the controller during a DFS event. Set to 1 to force the write.

bit_ranges.name: FSP1_FRC
bit_ranges.description: Identifies which of the controllersfrequencycopyisassociat edwithFSP1.'

bit_ranges.name: FSP0_FRC
bit_ranges.description: Identifies which of the controllersfrequencycopyisassociat edwithFSP0.'

bit_ranges.name: FSP1_FRC_VALID
bit_ranges.description: Specifies whether the FSP set defined in the FSP1_FRC parameter reflects the frequency used to program the FSP1 registers.

bit_ranges.name: FSP0_FRC_VALID
bit_ranges.description: Specifies whether the FSP set defined in the FSP0_FRC parameter reflects the frequency used to program the FSP0 registers.

bit_ranges.name: AREF_MAX_DEFICIT
bit_ranges.description: AREF number of pending refreshes until the maximum number of refreshes has been exceeded.

bit_ranges.name: AREF_HIGH_THRESHOLD
bit_ranges.description: AREF number of pending refreshes until the high priority request is asserted.

bit_ranges.name: AREF_NORM_THRESHOLD
bit_ranges.description: AREF number of pending refreshes until the normal priority request is asserted.

bit_ranges.name: LONG_COUNT_MASK
bit_ranges.description: Reduces the length of the long counter from 1024 cycles. The only supported values are 0x00 (1024 cycles), 0x10 (512 clocks), 0x18 (256 clocks), 0x1C (128 clocks), 0x1E (64 clocks) and 0x1F (32 clocks).

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CALSTART_NORM_THRESHOLD_F0
bit_ranges.description: ZQ START number of long counts until the normal priority request is asserted for frequency copy 0. This value should be scaled based on the number of ranks (chip selects) the controller handles. The more chip selects there are, the more rotations there are to go through, and the smaller this threshold should be.

bit_ranges.name: AREF_MAX_CREDIT
bit_ranges.description: AREF number of posted refreshes until the maximum number of refresh credits has been reached.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CALLATCH_HIGH_THRESHOLD_F0
bit_ranges.description: ZQ LATCH number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CALSTART_HIGH_THRESHOLD_F0
bit_ranges.description: ZQ START number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CS_HIGH_THRESHOLD_F0
bit_ranges.description: ZQ CS number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CS_NORM_THRESHOLD_F0
bit_ranges.description: ZQ CS number of long counts until the normal priority request is asserted for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CALLATCH_TIMEOUT_F0
bit_ranges.description: ZQ LATCH number of long counts until the timeout is asserted for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CALSTART_TIMEOUT_F0
bit_ranges.description: ZQ START number of long counts until the timeout is asserted for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F0
bit_ranges.description: ZQ SW promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CS_TIMEOUT_F0
bit_ranges.description: ZQ CS number of long counts until the timeout is asserted for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CALSTART_HIGH_THRESHOLD_F1
bit_ranges.description: ZQ START number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CALSTART_NORM_THRESHOLD_F1
bit_ranges.description: ZQ START number of long counts until the normal priority request is asserted for frequency copy 1. This value should be scaled based on the number of ranks (chip selects) the controller handles. The more chip selects there are, the more rotations there are to go through, and the smaller this threshold should be.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CS_NORM_THRESHOLD_F1
bit_ranges.description: ZQ CS number of long counts until the normal priority request is asserted for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CALLATCH_HIGH_THRESHOLD_F1
bit_ranges.description: ZQ LATCH number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.description: ZQ START number of long counts until the timeout is asserted for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CS_HIGH_THRESHOLD_F1
bit_ranges.description: ZQ CS number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CS_TIMEOUT_F1
bit_ranges.description: ZQ CS number of long counts until the timeout is asserted for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CALLATCH_TIMEOUT_F1
bit_ranges.description: ZQ LATCH number of long counts until the timeout is asserted for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CALSTART_NORM_THRESHOLD_F2

This value should be scaled based on the number of ranks (chip selects) the controller handles. The more chip selects there are, the more rotations there are to go through, and the smaller this threshold should be.

bit_ranges.description: ZQ SW promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.description: ZQ LATCH number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.description: ZQ START number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.description: ZQ CS number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CS_NORM_THRESHOLD_F2
bit_ranges.description: ZQ CS number of long counts until the normal priority request is asserted for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CALLATCH_TIMEOUT_F2
bit_ranges.description: ZQ LATCH number of long counts until the timeout is asserted for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CALSTART_TIMEOUT_F2
bit_ranges.description: ZQ START number of long counts until the timeout is asserted for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F2
bit_ranges.description: ZQ SW promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CS_TIMEOUT_F2
bit_ranges.description: ZQ CS number of long counts until the timeout is asserted for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: ZQINIT_F0
bit_ranges.description: Number of cycles needed for a ZQINIT command for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use. Refer to the regconfig files for the default programming.

bit_ranges.name: ZQCS_F0
bit_ranges.description: Number of cycles needed for a ZQCS command for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: ZQCL_F0
bit_ranges.description: Number of cycles needed for a ZQCL command for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: TZQLAT_F0
bit_ranges.description: Holds the DRAM ZQLAT value for frequency copy 0 in cycles.

bit_ranges.name: TZQCAL_F0
bit_ranges.description: Holds the DRAM ZQCAL value for frequency copy 0 in cycles.

bit_ranges.name: ZQCL_F1
bit_ranges.description: Number of cycles needed for a ZQCL command for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: ZQINIT_F1
bit_ranges.description: Number of cycles needed for a ZQINIT command for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: TZQCAL_F1
bit_ranges.description: Holds the DRAM ZQCAL value for frequency copy 1 in cycles.

bit_ranges.name: ZQCS_F1
bit_ranges.description: Number of cycles needed for a ZQCS command for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: ZQINIT_F2
bit_ranges.description: Number of cycles needed for a ZQINIT command for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: TZQLAT_F1
bit_ranges.description: Holds the DRAM ZQLAT value for frequency copy 1 in cycles.

bit_ranges.name: ZQCS_F2
bit_ranges.description: Number of cycles needed for a ZQCS command for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: ZQCL_F2
bit_ranges.description: Number of cycles needed for a ZQCL command for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_SW_REQ_START_LATCH_MAP
bit_ranges.description: Specifies which chip selects will simultaneously receive a ZQ start or latch command once the ZQ_REQ parameter is written with a ZQ Start or ZQ Latch command.

bit_ranges.name: TZQLAT_F2
bit_ranges.description: Holds the DRAM ZQLAT value for frequency copy 2 in cycles.

bit_ranges.name: TZQCAL_F2
bit_ranges.description: Holds the DRAM ZQCAL value for frequency copy 2 in cycles.

bit_ranges.name: ZQRESET_F0
bit_ranges.description: Number of cycles needed for a ZQRESET command for frequency copy 0.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_REQ_PENDING
bit_ranges.description: Indicates that a ZQ command is currently in progress or waiting to run. Value of 1 indicates command in progress or waiting to run. When this is asserted, no writes to ZQ_REQ should occur.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_REQ
bit_ranges.description: User request to initiate a ZQ calibration. Program to 0x1 for ZQ Short (ZQCS), program to 0x2 for ZQ Long (ZQCL), program to 0x3 for ZQ Start, program to 0x4 for ZQ Initialization (ZQINIT), program to 0x5 for ZQ Latch, or program to 0x8 for ZQ Reset. Clearing to 0x0 will not trigger any ZQ command. This parameter should only be written when the ZQ_REQ_PENDING parameter is cleared to 0.

bit_ranges.name: ZQRESET_F2
bit_ranges.description: Number of cycles needed for a ZQRESET command for frequency copy 2.

bit_ranges.name: ZQRESET_F1
bit_ranges.description: Number of cycles needed for a ZQRESET command for frequency copy 1.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CAL_LATCH_MAP_0
bit_ranges.description: Defines which chip select(s) will receive ZQ calibration latch commands simultaneously on iteration 0 of the ZQ LATCH initialization and periodic command sequences. Clear to all zeros for no ZQ LATCH commands.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CAL_START_MAP_0
bit_ranges.description: Defines which chip select(s) will receive ZQ calibration start commands simultaneously on iteration 0 of the ZQ START initialization and periodic command sequences. Clear to all zeros for no ZQ START commands.

bit_ranges.name: ZQCS_ROTATE
bit_ranges.description: For non-LPDDR4 memories, selects whether a ZQCS command will calibrate just one chip select or all chip selects. When rotation is off, all chip selects will be calibrated, requiring a longer time frame, but ZQ calibration will need to be performed less frequently. Set to 1 for rotating CS. For LPDDR4 memories, this parameter is ignored.

bit_ranges.name: NO_ZQ_INIT
bit_ranges.description: Disable ZQ operations during initialization. Set to 1 to disable.

bit_ranges.name: ROW_DIFF
bit_ranges.description: Difference between number of address pins available and number being used.

bit_ranges.name: BANK_DIFF
bit_ranges.description: Encoded number of banks on the DRAM(s).

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CAL_LATCH_MAP_1
bit_ranges.description: Defines which chip select(s) will receive ZQ calibration latch commands simultaneously on iteration 1 of the ZQ LATCH initialization and periodic command sequences. Clear to all zeros for no ZQ LATCH commands.

bit_ranges.name: ZQ_CAL_START_MAP_1
bit_ranges.description: Defines which chip select(s) will receive ZQ calibration start commands simultaneously on iteration 1 of the ZQ START initialization and periodic command sequences. Clear to all zeros for no ZQ START commands.

bit_ranges.name: APREBIT
bit_ranges.description: Location of the auto pre-charge bit in the DRAM address.

bit_ranges.name: BANK_ADDR_INTLV_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enables the capability to interleave the bank address within the row address bits. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: BANK_START_BIT
bit_ranges.description: Defines the LSbit of the bank address within the page of the user address when the BANK_ADDR_INTLV_EN parameter is set.

bit_ranges.name: COL_DIFF
bit_ranges.description: Difference between number of column pins available and number being used.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use. Refer to the regconfig files for the default programming.

bit_ranges.name: ADDR_CMP_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enable address collision detection as a rule for command queue placement. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: COMMAND_AGE_COUNT
bit_ranges.description: Initial value of individual command aging counters for command aging.

bit_ranges.name: AGE_COUNT
bit_ranges.description: Initial value of master aging-rate counter for command aging.

bit_ranges.name: RW_SAME_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enable read/write grouping as a rule for command queue placement. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: PRIORITY_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enable priority as a rule for command queue placement. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: PLACEMENT_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enable placement logic for command queue. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: BANK_SPLIT_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enable bank splitting as a rule for command queue placement. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: DISABLE_RW_GROUP_W_BNK_CONFLICT
bit_ranges.description: Disables placement to read/write group when grouping creates a bank collision. Bit (0) controls placement next to bank conflict command and bit (1) controls placement 2 away from bank conflict command. Set each bit to 1 to disable.

bit_ranges.name: W2R_SPLIT_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enable splitting of commands to the same chip select from a write to a read command as a rule for command queue placement.

bit_ranges.name: CS_SAME_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enable chip select grouping when read/write grouping as a rule for command queue placement. This is only valid when the RW_SAME_EN parameter is set. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: RW_SAME_PAGE_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enable page grouping when read/ write grouping as a rule for command queue placement. This is only valid when the RW_SAME_EN parameter is set. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: INHIBIT_DRAM_CMD
bit_ranges.description: Inhibit command types from being executed from the command queue. Clear to 0 to enable any command, program to 1 to inhibit read/write and bank commands, program to 2 to inhibit MRR and peripheral MRR commands, or program to 3 to inhibit MRR and read/write commands.

bit_ranges.name: DISABLE_RD_INTERLEAVE
bit_ranges.description: Disable read data interleaving for commands from the same port, regardless of the requestor ID.

bit_ranges.name: SWAP_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enable command swapping logic in execution unit. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: NUM_Q_ENTRIES_ACT_DISABLE
bit_ranges.description: Number of queue entries in which ACT requests will be disabled. Setting to X will disable ACT requests from the X entries lowest in the command queue.

bit_ranges.name: BIG_ENDIAN_EN
bit_ranges.description: Set byte ordering as little endian or big endian. Set to 1 for big endian.

bit_ranges.name: REDUC
bit_ranges.description: Enable the half datapath feature of the controller. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: BURST_ON_FLY_BIT
bit_ranges.description: Identifies the burst-on-fly bit in the memory mode registers.

bit_ranges.name: CS_MAP
bit_ranges.description: Defines which chip selects are active.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use. Refer to the regconfig files for the default programming.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use. Refer to the regconfig files for the default programming.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use. Refer to the regconfig files for the default programming.

bit_ranges.name: MEMDATA_RATIO_0
bit_ranges.description: Defines the ratio of the DRAM device size on chip select 0 to the memory data width. Program with the log2 ratio of the memory data width to the device data width.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use. Refer to the regconfig files for the default programming.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED

bit_ranges.name: MEMDATA_RATIO_1

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use. Refer to the regconfig files for the default programming.

bit_ranges.name: IN_ORDER_ACCEPT
bit_ranges.description: Forces the controller to accept commands in the order in which they are placed in the command queue.

bit_ranges.name: Q_FULLNESS
bit_ranges.description: Quantity that determines command queue full.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use. Refer to the regconfig files for the default programming.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use. Refer to the regconfig files for the default programming.

bit_ranges.name: PREAMBLE_SUPPORT

bit_ranges.description: Enable an automatic controller- initiated update (dfi_ctrlupd_req) after every refresh. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: CTRLUPD_REQ

bit_ranges.name: CONTROLLER_BUSY

bit_ranges.name: DFI_ERROR
bit_ranges.description: Indicates that the DFI error flag has been asserted.

bit_ranges.name: RD_DBI_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enables controller support of DRAM DBI feature for read data with DDR4 devices. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: WR_DBI_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enables controller support of DRAM DBI feature for write data with DDR4 devices. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: RD_PREAMBLE_TRAINING_EN

bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use. Refer to the regconfig files for the default programming.

bit_ranges.name: DFI_ERROR_INFO

bit_ranges.name: TODTL_2CMD_F1
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DRAM delay from an ODT de-assertion to the next non- write, non-read command.

bit_ranges.name: TODTL_2CMD_F0

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_REQ
bit_ranges.description: User request to initiate CA training. Set to 1 to trigger.

bit_ranges.name: RDLVL_GATE_DFI_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F2
bit_ranges.description: Gate training promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted. Applies to DFI commands.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_PAT_0
bit_ranges.description: CA Training pattern 0 driven on the CA bus during a calibration command.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_BG_PAT_0
bit_ranges.description: CA Training pattern 0 driven on the CA bus before and after a calibration command.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_PAT_1
bit_ranges.description: CA Training pattern 1 driven on the CA bus during a calibration command.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_BG_PAT_1
bit_ranges.description: CA Training pattern 1 driven on the CA bus before and after a calibration command.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_PAT_2
bit_ranges.description: CA Training pattern 2 driven on the CA bus during a calibration command.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_BG_PAT_2
bit_ranges.description: CA Training pattern 2 driven on the CA bus before and after a calibration command.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_PAT_3
bit_ranges.description: CA Training pattern 3 driven on the CA bus during a calibration command.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use. Refer to the regconfig files for the default programming.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_BG_PAT_3
bit_ranges.description: CA Training pattern 3 driven on the CA bus before and after a calibration command.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_PERIODIC
bit_ranges.description: Enables the use of the dfi_lvl_periodic signal during CA training. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: DFI_PHY_CALVL_MODE
bit_ranges.description: Specifies the PHY support for DFI CA training. Set to 1 for supported.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_SEQ_EN
bit_ranges.description: Specifies which CA training patterns will be used. Clear to 0 for pattern 0 only, program to 1 for patterns 0 and 1, program to 2 for patterns 0, 1 and 2, or program to 3 for all patterns.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use. Refer to the regconfig files for the default programming.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_CS_MAP
bit_ranges.description: Defines the chip select map for CA training operations. Bit (0) controls cs0, bit (1) controls cs1, etc. Set each bit to 1 to enable chip for CA training.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_ROTATE
bit_ranges.description: Enables rotational CS for interval CA training. Set to 1 for rotating CS.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_AREF_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enables refreshes and other non- data commands to execute in the middle of CA training. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_ON_SREF_EXIT
bit_ranges.description: Enables automatic CA training on a self-refresh exit. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_HIGH_THRESHOLD_F0
bit_ranges.description: CA training high threshold number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_NORM_THRESHOLD_F0
bit_ranges.description: CA training normal threshold number of long counts until the normal priority request is asserted.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_SW_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F0
bit_ranges.description: CA training promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted. Applies to SW commands.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_TIMEOUT_F0
bit_ranges.description: CA training timeout number of long counts until the timeout is asserted.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_NORM_THRESHOLD_F1
bit_ranges.description: CA training normal threshold number of long counts until the normal priority request is asserted.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_DFI_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F0
bit_ranges.description: CA training promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted. Applies to DFI commands.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_TIMEOUT_F1
bit_ranges.description: CA training timeout number of long counts until the timeout is asserted.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_HIGH_THRESHOLD_F1
bit_ranges.description: CA training high threshold number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_DFI_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F1
bit_ranges.description: CA training promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted. Applies to DFI commands.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_SW_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F1
bit_ranges.description: CA training promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted. Applies to SW commands.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_HIGH_THRESHOLD_F2
bit_ranges.description: CA training high threshold number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_NORM_THRESHOLD_F2
bit_ranges.description: CA training normal threshold number of long counts until the normal priority request is asserted.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_SW_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F2
bit_ranges.description: CA training promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted. Applies to SW commands.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_TIMEOUT_F2
bit_ranges.description: CA training timeout number of long counts until the timeout is asserted.

bit_ranges.name: CKE_STATUS
bit_ranges.description: Register access to cke_status signal.

bit_ranges.name: DENALI0_ALLDATAUSED_ENABLE
bit_ranges.description: Enables use of the ALLDATAUSED signal for DENALI port 0. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_DFI_PROMOTE_THRESHOLD_F2
bit_ranges.description: CA training promotion number of long counts until the high priority request is asserted. Applies to DFI commands.

bit_ranges.name: DLL_RST_ADJ_DLY
bit_ranges.description: Minimum cycles after setting master delay in DLL until the DLL reset signal dll_rst_n may be asserted. If this signal is not being used by the PHY, this parameter may be ignored.

bit_ranges.name: DLL_RST_DELAY
bit_ranges.description: Minimum cycles required for DLL reset signal dll_rst_n to be held. If this signal is not being used by the PHY, this parameter may be ignored.

bit_ranges.name: MEM_RST_VALID
bit_ranges.description: Register access to mem_rst_valid signal.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_PHY_RDLAT_F1
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHY_RDLAT timing parameter (in DFI PHY clocks), the maximum cycles between a dfi_rddata_en assertion and a dfi_rddata_valid assertion.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_PHY_RDLAT_F0
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHY_RDLAT timing parameter (in DFI PHY clocks), the maximum cycles between a dfi_rddata_en assertion and a dfi_rddata_valid assertion.

bit_ranges.name: UPDATE_ERROR_STATUS
bit_ranges.description: Identifies the source of any DFI MC-initiated or PHY-initiated update errors. Value of 1 indicates a timing violation of the associated timing parameter.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_PHY_WRLAT
bit_ranges.description: Holds the calculated DFI tPHY_WRLAT timing parameter (in DFI PHY clocks), the maximum cycles between a write command and a dfi_wrdata_en assertion.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_CTRLUPD_MIN
bit_ranges.description: Reports the DFI tCTRLUPD_MIN timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the minimum cycles that dfi_ctrlupd_req must be asserted.

bit_ranges.name: DRAM_CLK_DISABLE
bit_ranges.description: Set value for the dfi_dram_clk_disable signal. Bit (0) controls cs0, bit (1) controls cs1, etc. Set each bit to 1 to disable.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_RDDATA_EN
bit_ranges.description: Holds the calculated DFI tRDDATA_EN timing parameter (in DFI PHY clocks), the maximum cycles between a read command and a dfi_rddata_en assertion.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_PHY_RDLAT_F2
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHY_RDLAT timing parameter (in DFI PHY clocks), the maximum cycles between a dfi_rddata_en assertion and a dfi_rddata_valid assertion.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_CTRLUPD_MAX_F0
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tCTRLUPD_MAX timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles that dfi_ctrlupd_req can be asserted. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (1) set in the UPDATE_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_PHYUPD_TYPE0_F0
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHYUPD_TYPE0 timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles that dfi_phyupd_req can assert after dfi_phyupd_ack for dfi_phyupd_type 0. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (2) set in the UPDATE_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_PHYUPD_TYPE1_F0
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHYUPD_TYPE1 timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles that dfi_phyupd_req can assert after dfi_phyupd_ack for dfi_phyupd_type 1. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (3) set in the UPDATE_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_PHYUPD_TYPE2_F0
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHYUPD_TYPE2 timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles that dfi_phyupd_req can assert afterdfi_phyupd_ack for dfi_phyupd_type 2. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (4) set in the UPDATE_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_PHYUPD_TYPE3_F0
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHYUPD_TYPE3 timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles that dfi_phyupd_req can assert after dfi_phyupd_ack for dfi_phyupd_type 3. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (5) set in the UPDATE_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_PHYUPD_RESP_F0
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHYUPD_RESP timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles between a dfi_phyupd_req assertion and a dfi_phyupd_ack assertion. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (6) set in the UPDATE_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_CTRLUPD_INTERVAL_F0
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tCTRLUPD_INTERVAL timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles between dfi_ctrlupd_req assertions. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (0) set in the UPDATE_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_CTRLUPD_MAX_F1
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tCTRLUPD_MAX timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles that dfi_ctrlupd_req can be asserted. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (1) set in the UPDATE_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: WRLAT_ADJ_F0
bit_ranges.description: Adjustment value for PHY write timing.

bit_ranges.name: RDLAT_ADJ_F0
bit_ranges.description: Adjustment value for PHY read timing.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_PHYUPD_TYPE0_F1
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHYUPD_TYPE0 timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles that dfi_phyupd_req can assert afterdfi_phyupd_ack for dfi_phyupd_type 0. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (2) set in the UPDATE_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_PHYUPD_TYPE1_F1
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHYUPD_TYPE1 timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles that dfi_phyupd_req can assert after dfi_phyupd_ack for dfi_phyupd_type 1. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (3) set in the UPDATE_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_PHYUPD_TYPE2_F1
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHYUPD_TYPE2 timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles that dfi_phyupd_req can assert after dfi_phyupd_ack for dfi_phyupd_type 2. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (4) set in the UPDATE_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_PHYUPD_TYPE3_F1
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHYUPD_TYPE3 timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles that dfi_phyupd_req can assert after dfi_phyupd_ack for dfi_phyupd_type 3. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (5) set in the UPDATE_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_PHYUPD_RESP_F1
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHYUPD_RESP timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles between a dfi_phyupd_req assertion and a dfi_phyupd_ack assertion. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (6) set in the UPDATE_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_CTRLUPD_INTERVAL_F1
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tCTRLUPD_INTERVAL timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles between dfi_ctrlupd_req assertions. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (0) set in the UPDATE_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_CTRLUPD_MAX_F2
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tCTRLUPD_MAX timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles that dfi_ctrlupd_req can be asserted. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (1) set in the UPDATE_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: WRLAT_ADJ_F1
bit_ranges.description: Adjustment value for PHY write timing.

bit_ranges.name: RDLAT_ADJ_F1
bit_ranges.description: Adjustment value for PHY read timing.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_PHYUPD_TYPE0_F2
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHYUPD_TYPE0 timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles that dfi_phyupd_req can assert after dfi_phyupd_ack for dfi_phyupd_type 0. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (2) set in the UPDATE_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_PHYUPD_TYPE1_F2
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHYUPD_TYPE1 timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles that dfi_phyupd_req can assert after dfi_phyupd_ack for dfi_phyupd_type 1. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (3) set in the UPDATE_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_PHYUPD_TYPE2_F2
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHYUPD_TYPE2 timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles that dfi_phyupd_req can assert after dfi_phyupd_ack for dfi_phyupd_type 2. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (4) set in the UPDATE_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_PHYUPD_TYPE3_F2
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHYUPD_TYPE3 timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles that dfi_phyupd_req can assert after dfi_phyupd_ack for dfi_phyupd_type 3. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (5) set in the UPDATE_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_PHYUPD_RESP_F2
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHYUPD_RESP timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles between a dfi_phyupd_req assertion and a dfi_phyupd_ack assertion. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (6) set in the UPDATE_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_CTRLUPD_INTERVAL_F2
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tCTRLUPD_INTERVAL timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles between dfi_ctrlupd_req assertions. If programmed to a non-zero, a timing violation will cause an interrupt and bit (0) set in the UPDATE_ERROR_STATUS parameter.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_CTRL_DELAY_F1
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tCTRL_DELAY timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the delay between a DFI command change and a memory command.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_CTRL_DELAY_F0
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tCTRL_DELAY timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the delay between a DFI command change and a memory command.

bit_ranges.name: WRLAT_ADJ_F2
bit_ranges.description: Adjustment value for PHY write timing.

bit_ranges.name: RDLAT_ADJ_F2
bit_ranges.description: Adjustment value for PHY read timing.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_WRLVL_EN
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tWRLVL_EN timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the minimum cycles from a dfi_wrlvl_en assertion to the first dfi_wrlvl_strobe assertion.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_DRAM_CLK_ENABLE
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tDRAM_CLK_ENABLE timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the delay between a dfi_dram_clk_disable de-assertion and the memory clock enable.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_DRAM_CLK_DISABLE
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tDRAM_CLK_DISABLE timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the delay between a dfi_dram_clock_disable assertion and the memory clock disable.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_CTRL_DELAY_F2
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tCTRL_DELAY timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the delay between a DFI command change and a memory command.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_WRLVL_WW
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tWRLVL_WW timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the minimum cycles between dfi_wrlvl_strobe assertions.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_WRLVL_RESP
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tWRLVL_RESP timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles between a dfi_wrlvl_req assertion and a dfi_wrlvl_en assertion.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_WRLVL_MAX
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tWRLVL_MAX timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles between a dfi_wrlvl_en assertion and a valid dfi_wrlvl_resp.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_RDLVL_RR
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tRDLVL_RR timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the minimum cycles between read commands.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_RDLVL_EN
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tRDLVL_EN timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the minimum cycles from a dfi_rdlvl_en or dfi_rdlvl_gate_en assertion to the first read or MRR.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_RDLVL_RESP
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tRDLVL_RESP timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles between a dfi_rdlvl_req or dfi_rdlvl_gate_req assertion and a dfi_rdlvl_en or dfi_rdlvl_gate_en assertion.

bit_ranges.name: RDLVL_GATE_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enable the MC gate training module. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: RDLVL_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enable the MC data eye training module. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: RDLVL_RESP_MASK
bit_ranges.description: Mask for the dfi_rdlvl_resp signal during data eye training.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_RDLVL_MAX
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tRDLVL_MAX timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles between a dfi_rdlvl_en or dfi_rdlvl_gate_en assertion and a valid dfi_rdlvl_resp.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_CALVL_EN
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tCALVL_EN timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the minimum cycles between a dfi_calvl_en assertion and a dfi_cke de-assertion.

bit_ranges.name: RDLVL_GATE_ERROR_STATUS
bit_ranges.description: Holds the error associated with the read gate training error or gate training error interrupt. Uppermost bit set indicates a TDFI_RDLVL_RESP parameter violation. Next uppermost bit set indicates a TDFI_RDLVL_MAX parameter violation. Lower bits are reserved.

bit_ranges.name: RDLVL_ERROR_STATUS
bit_ranges.description: Holds the error associated with the data eye training error or gate training error interrupt. Uppermost bit set indicates a TDFI_RDLVL_RESP parameter violation. Next uppermost bit set indicates a TDFI_RDLVL_MAX parameter violation. Lower bits are reserved.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_CALVL_CAPTURE_F0
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tCALVL_CAPTURE timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the minimum cycles between a calibration command and a dfi_calvl_capture pulse.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_CALVL_CC_F0
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tCALVL_CC timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the minimum cycles between calibration commands.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_CALVL_CAPTURE_F1
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tCALVL_CAPTURE timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the minimum cycles between a calibration command and a dfi_calvl_capture pulse.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_CALVL_CC_F1
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tCALVL_CC timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the minimum cycles between calibration commands.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_CALVL_CAPTURE_F2
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tCALVL_CAPTURE timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the minimum cycles between a calibration command and a dfi_calvl_capture pulse.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_CALVL_CC_F2
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tCALVL_CC timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the minimum cycles between calibration commands.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_CALVL_RESP
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tCALVL_RESP timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles between a dfi_calvl_req assertion and a dfi_calvl_en assertion.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_CALVL_MAX
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tCALVL_MAX timing parameter (in DFI clocks), the maximum cycles between a dfi_calvl_en assertion and a valid dfi_calvl_resp.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_PHY_WRDATA
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHY_WRDATA timing parameter (in DFI PHY clocks), the maximum cycles between a dfi_wrdata_en assertion and a dfi_wrdata signal.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_ERROR_STATUS
bit_ranges.description: Holds the error associated with the CA training error interrupt. Bit (0) set indicates a TDFI_CALVL_RESP parameter violation and bit (1) set indicates a TDFI_CALVL_MAX parameter violation.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_EN
bit_ranges.description: Enable the MC CA training module. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: CALVL_RESP_MASK
bit_ranges.description: Mask for the dfi_calvl_resp signal during CA training.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_WRCSLAT_F1
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHY_WRCSLAT timing parameter (in DFI PHY clocks), the maximum cycles between a write command and a dfi_wrdata_cs_n assertion.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_RDCSLAT_F1
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHY_RDCSLAT timing parameter (in DFI PHY clocks), the maximum cycles between a read command and a dfi_rddata_cs_n assertion.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_WRCSLAT_F0
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHY_WRCSLAT timing parameter (in DFI PHY clocks), the maximum cycles between a write command and a dfi_wrdata_cs_n assertion.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_RDCSLAT_F0
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHY_RDCSLAT timing parameter (in DFI PHY clocks), the maximum cycles between a read command and a dfi_rddata_cs_n assertion.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_WRDATA_DELAY
bit_ranges.description: Defines the tWRDATA_DELAY timing parameter (in DFI PHY clocks), the maximum cycles between when the dfi_wrdata_en signal is asserted and when the corresponding write data transfer is completed on the DRAM bus.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_WRCSLAT_F2
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHY_WRCSLAT timing parameter (in DFI PHY clocks), the maximum cycles between a write command and a dfi_wrdata_cs_n assertion.

bit_ranges.name: TDFI_RDCSLAT_F2
bit_ranges.description: Defines the DFI tPHY_RDCSLAT timing parameter (in DFI PHY clocks), the maximum cycles between a read command and a dfi_rddata_cs_n assertion.

bit_ranges.name: USER_DEF_REG_0
bit_ranges.description: User-defined output register 0.

bit_ranges.name: USER_DEF_REG_RO_0
bit_ranges.description: User-defined input register 0.

bit_ranges.name: USER_DEF_REG_COPIED_F0_0
bit_ranges.description: User-defined copied output register 0.

bit_ranges.name: USER_DEF_REG_COPIED_F0_1
bit_ranges.description: User-defined copied output register 1.

bit_ranges.name: USER_DEF_REG_COPIED_F1_0
bit_ranges.description: User-defined copied output register 0.

bit_ranges.name: USER_DEF_REG_COPIED_F1_1
bit_ranges.description: User-defined copied output register 1.

bit_ranges.name: USER_DEF_REG_COPIED_F2_0
bit_ranges.description: User-defined copied output register 0.

bit_ranges.name: USER_DEF_REG_COPIED_F2_1
bit_ranges.description: User-defined copied output register 1.

bit_ranges.name: MULTI_CHANNEL_ZQ_CAL_MASTER
bit_ranges.description: In a two controller scenario, defines if this controller will issue ZQ calibration start commands when neither controller is in a low power mode. Set to 1 to define this controller as the master that issues ZQ calibration start commands or clear to 0 to define this controller as the slave. This parameter should only be programmed once during initialization.

bit_ranges.name: BL_ON_FLY_ENABLE
bit_ranges.description: Enables the burst length on the fly feature. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: DISABLE_MEMORY_MASKED_WRITE
bit_ranges.description: Restricts the controller from masked write commands. Set to 1 to not issue these commands.

bit_ranges.name: EN_1T_TIMING
bit_ranges.description: Enable 1T timing in a system supporting both 1T and 2T timing. Set to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: PHY_DQ_DM_SWIZZLE0_0
bit_ranges.description: DQ/DM bit swizzling 0 for slice 0. Bits (3:0) inform the PHY which bit in {DM,DQ]} map to DQ0, Bits (7:4) inform the PHY which bit in {DM,DQ} map to DQ1, etc.

bit_ranges.name: PHY_CLK_WR_BYPASS_SLAVE_DELAY_0
bit_ranges.description: Write data clock bypass mode slave delay setting for slice 0.

bit_ranges.name: PHY_DQ_DM_SWIZZLE1_0
bit_ranges.description: DQ/DM bit swizzling 1 for slice 0. Bits (3:0) inform the PHY which bit in {DM,DQ]} map to DM.

bit_ranges.name: PHY_CLK_BYPASS_OVERRIDE_0
bit_ranges.description: Bypass mode override setting for slice 0.

bit_ranges.name: PHY_BYPASS_TWO_CYC_PREAMBLE_0
bit_ranges.description: PHY two_cycle_preamble for bypass mode for slice 0.

bit_ranges.name: PHY_DQ_TSEL_ENABLE_0
bit_ranges.description: Operation type tsel enables for DQ/ DM signals for slice 0. Bit (0) enables tsel_en during read cycles. Bit (1) enables tsel_en during write cycles. Bit (2) enables tsel_en during idle cycles. Set each bit to 1 to enable.

bit_ranges.name: PHY_SW_WRDQS_SHIFT_0
bit_ranges.description: Manual override of automatic half_cycle_shift/cycle_shift for write DQS for slice 0. Bit (0) enables override of half_cycle_shift. Bit (1) is the half_cycle_shift value. Bit (2) enables override of cycle shift. Bit (3) is the cycle_shift value.

bit_ranges.name: PHY_SW_WRDM_SHIFT_0
